results.headline: Review: ‘Paths of the Soul,’ a Road Trip Unlike Any Other
results.summary_short: Chronicling a 1,200-mile pilgrimage by the Buddhist residents of a Tibetan village, this movie upends the traditions of documentary and narrative filmmaking.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Paths of the Soul

results.headline: Review: Cops in ‘The Trust’ Spice Up Deadly Dull Jobs
results.summary_short: Nicolas Cage and Elijah Wood play police-department partners who deal with boredom, social invisibility and pent-up rage by planning a heist.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Trust

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Lobster,’ Colin Farrell Plays a Divorced Man in a Loner-Hating Society
results.summary_short: Yorgos Lanthimos’s surreal allegory about tyrannical monogamy and its direct counterpart is dosed with bitterness as well as comic whimsy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Lobster

results.headline: Review: In ‘High-Rise,’ Tom Hiddleston and Class War Hit a Low Point
results.summary_short: Ben Wheatley adapts J.G. Ballard’s futuristic novel about a residential building that descends into decadence and barbarism.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of High-Rise

results.headline: Review: Vengeance, Thy Name Is Travolta, in ‘I Am Wrath’
results.summary_short: A savage attack in a parking garage leaves a political aide dead and her husband desperate for justice when the police don’t seem terribly concerned.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Am Wrath

results.headline: Review: ‘Kill Zone 2’ Packs a Wallop With Orchestrated Mayhem
results.summary_short: This Soi Cheang film, involving a principled prison guard with an ill daughter, has plot and subplot, but the action scenes are most notable.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kill Zone 2

results.headline: Review: ‘Pelé: Birth of a Legend’ Charts a Superstar’s Rise
results.summary_short: This biopic follows the ascent of the Brazilian soccer player who became the sport’s greatest ambassador.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Pelé: Birth of a Legend

results.headline: Review: ‘What We Become’ Finds Zombies in Broad Daylight
results.summary_short: This Danish horror film focuses on a family’s breakdown after a virus threatens an affluent suburb.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of What We Become

results.headline: Review: In ‘Money Monster,’ a Broke Investor Holds a Grudge and a Gun
results.summary_short: George Clooney plays a financial news talk-show host, and Julia Roberts is his producer in this self-assured hostage drama.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Money Monster

results.display_title: A Monster With a Thousand Heads
results.headline: Review: Health Care Bureaucracy Runs Amok in ‘A Monster With a Thousand Heads’
results.summary_short: A woman’s struggle to secure expensive medication for her ill husband is the focal point of this Rodrigo Plá film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Monster With a Thousand Heads

results.headline: Review: ‘Dheepan,’ About Sri Lankan Refugees, Looks Like a Prophecy
results.summary_short: In Jacques Audiard’s Palme d’Or-winning film, the members of a makeshift family find that a housing project near Paris feels like the war zone they just left.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dheepan

results.headline: Review: ‘Elstree 1976,’ in a Galaxy Not Far, Far Away
results.summary_short: This Jon Spira documentary is about actors who played small roles in parts of the original “Star Wars” that were filmed in London.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Elstree 1976

results.headline: Review: ‘Belladonna of Sadness,’ a Bewitching Masterpiece
results.summary_short: Eiichi Yamamoto’s 1973 animated film, replete with shocking imagery, is watchable even at its most disturbing.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Belladonna of Sadness

results.headline: Review: In ‘Dark Horse,’ a Real-Life Steeplechase Champion Inspires a Town
results.summary_short: Subtitled “The Incredible True Story of Dream Alliance,” this documentary recounts the rise of a foal who restored a Welsh village’s spirits.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dark Horse

results.headline: Review: ‘Mothers and Daughters,’ in Which Souls Are Laid Bare
results.summary_short: Written by Paige Cameron, this movie includes many of the difficult conversations typical of these relationships, just in time for Mother’s Day.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mothers and Daughters

results.headline: Review: In ‘Phantom of the Theater,’ Spirits Seek Revenge
results.summary_short: The themes of horror and romance are set in a 1930s Shanghai movie palace in this film directed by Raymond Yip.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Phantom of the Theater

results.headline: Review: ‘Beautiful Something’: Craving Love in Philadelphia
results.summary_short: Joseph Graham’s movie is a bleak, agonized study of gay men looking for some kind of connection.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Beautiful Something

results.headline: Review: ‘Those People’: Heartbreak Among the Upper Crust
results.summary_short: In Joey Kuhn’s directorial debut, wealthy young men in Manhattan pine for one another and play coy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Those People

results.headline: Review: ‘Bridgend,’ on a Mysterious Cluster of Suicides in Wales
results.summary_short: This fictional film, directed by Jeppe Ronde, is based on a real-life tale involving the deaths of dozens of young people over the last decade.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bridgend

results.headline: Review: ‘Rabin in His Own Words’ Fleshes Out an Israeli Politician, With Limits
results.summary_short: The documentary, consisting of recollections by Yitzhak Rabin, who served twice as prime minister, is viewer-friendly but lacks critical perspective.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rabin in His Own Words
